title: Rove McManus announce career change after his pilot series was cancelled
text:
His new show Saturday Night Rove was cancelled after just two episodes.

And on Tuesday, Rove McManus revealed his two new children's books, with his career currently focused on his achievements as an author.

The 45-year-old Nine Honey: 'I've always found writing and drawing to be fantastic creative outlets since I was young.'

'Having a daughter to share stories with reignited my passion': Rove McManus (pictured) announced he's releasing two new children's books

He added: 'But more recently, having a daughter to share stories with reignited my passion for it.'

Rove's two new books, which he wrote and illustrated, are called Disgusting McGrossface and Rocky Lobstar: Rocky to the Rescue.

It comes after Rove revealed that his family life was his priority, after his new series failed to take off during Ten's pilot week trial last month.

Ouch: His new show Saturday Night Rove was cancelled after just two episodes last month

However he insisted that his TV days are not behind him, telling the Stellar: 'TV has been as much a part of my life as drawing. So I'm sure I'll find myself back there again, too'

'I have never had any hesitation about playing the monster or the superhero, or whatever is required when I'm playing with my daughter,' he told Stellar Magazine.

However he insisted that his TV days are not behind him, telling the publication: 'TV has been as much a part of my life as drawing. So I'm sure I'll find myself back there again, too.'

The Australian television presenter welcomed his first child, daughter Ruby, with actress Tasma Walton in 2013.

Talent! Rove's two new books, which he wrote and illustrated, are called Disgusting McGrossface and Rocky Lobstar: Rocky to the Rescue

The 45-year-old Nine Honey: 'I've always found writing and drawing to be fantastic creative outlets since I was young'

Family: Rove, 45, welcomed his first child, daughter Ruby, with actress Tasma Walton in 2013

Channel 10 boss Beverley McGarvey later claimed the network pulled the plug on Saturday Night Rove because Australians don't have an appetite for variety shows anymore.

But a former an executive at the network has refuted this, insisting that Rove McManus' new project was axed simply because 'it was s**t'.

Rob McKnight told Mumbrellacast that there is still a market for variety shows, but Saturday Night Rove failed because it didn't have the right tone.
description: His new show Saturday Night Rove was cancelled after just two episodes.
authors: Marta Jary For Daily Mail Australia
